Sentencas: Direct internal reforming enables optimal heat integration and reduced complexity in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) systems, but thermal stresses induced by the increased temperature gradients may inflict damage to the stack.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling of a direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell stack based on single cell experiments

Sentencas: Therefore, the development of adequate control strategies requires models that can accurately predict the temperature profiles in the stack.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling of a direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell stack based on single cell experiments

Sentencas: A 1D dynamic modelling platform is developed in this study, and used to simulate SOFCs in both single cell and stack configurations.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling of a direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell stack based on single cell experiments

Sentencas: The single cell model is used to validate power law and Hougen-Watson reforming kinetics derived from experiments in previous work.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling of a direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell stack based on single cell experiments

Sentencas: The stack model, based on the same type of cells, accounts for heat transfer in the inactive area and to the environment, and is validated with data reported by the manufacturer.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling of a direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell stack based on single cell experiments

Sentencas: The reforming kinetics are then implemented in the stack model to simulate operation with direct internal reforming.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling of a direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell stack based on single cell experiments

Sentencas: Although there are differences between the temperature profiles predicted by the two kinetic models, both are more realistic than assuming chemical equilibrium.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling of a direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell stack based on single cell experiments

Sentencas: The results highlight the need to identify rate limiting steps for the reforming and hydrogen oxidation reactions on anodes of functional SOFC assemblies.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling of a direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell stack based on single cell experiments

Sentencas: The modelling approach can be used to study off-design conditions, transient operation and system integration, as well as to develop adequate energy management and control strategies.
Titulo: Dynamic modelling of a direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell stack based on single cell experiments
